result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel W Baas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Term of probation: Discharge date of 2-10-2020 (the same as the expiration date of the injunction in Ozaukee County case 2016CV29)
42 days credit if revoked

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during the term of supervision.  
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment and any follow up couseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Anger management with any follow up.
No contact with victim: Lori E. Bachmann.
Submit to the DNA sample at the Ozaukee County Jail before release.

supervisions.notes: Court costs to be paid in full within 6 months (June 14, 2018). Failure to pay will result in 1 day in the County Jail for every $25 still due and owing.
02/07/2018 - Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant Daniel W Baas in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith addresses the court regarding motion for huber release.  State has no objection.  Court grants the motion.
to Modify Sentence.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Atty Smith requesting Hearing date for Motion for Huber Release. Clerk gave 2/7/18 at 8:15am.
Clerk rejected Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Sentence filed by Atty Smith - counsel to obtain a date before filing
in Support of Motion to Modify Sentence - Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk DA.
Revoked - Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC
copy sent electronically to DOC, copy emailed to jail, copy mailed to defendant c/o jail

Defendant Daniel W Baas in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant can file request and court will set for hearing.

Defendant Daniel W Baas in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Daniel W Baas in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause and accepts not guilty plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel W Baas appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McClendon advises defendant refusing public defender assistance today.  Court advises of the penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to counsel.  State requesting $3000 cash bail w/conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
